question_stem.en: A 58-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to a 3-hour history of abrupt-onset weakness and numbness of the right lower extremity, as well as urinary incontinence. Two months ago, the patient was hospitalized due to left-sided weakness that resolved spontaneously after several hours. At that time, MRI of the head and MR angiography of the head and neck were normal, but the patient was found to have atrial fibrillation. An oral anticoagulant was prescribed at discharge, but the patient has been nonadherent with therapy. Blood pressure is 162/94 mm Hg and pulse is 102/min and irregularly irregular. Physical examination shows weakness and sensory loss in the right lower extremity. Babinski sign is present on the right. Speech is normal, and there is no facial weakness. Examination of the right upper extremity and the left extremities is unremarkable. An embolic occlusion affecting which of the following vascular regions is the most likely cause of this patient's current symptoms?
question_stem.zh: 一名58岁男性因右下肢突发性无力和麻木，伴有尿失禁，来到急诊科就诊，病程3小时。两个月前，该患者因左侧肢体无力而住院，数小时后自发缓解。当时，头部MRI和头颈部MR血管造影正常，但患者被诊断为心房颤动。出院时处方口服抗凝药，但患者未按时服药。血压162/94 mmHg，脉搏102次/分钟，不规则。体格检查显示右下肢无力和感觉缺失。右侧存在Babinski征。言语正常，无面部无力。右侧上肢和左侧肢体检查无异常。影响以下哪个血管区域的栓塞最有可能导致患者目前的症状？

question.en: An embolic occlusion affecting which of the following vascular regions is the most likely cause of this patient's current symptoms?
question.zh: 影响以下哪个血管区域的栓塞最有可能导致患者目前的症状？

A.en: Anterior cerebral artery distal to the origin of the anterior communicating artery
A.zh: 大脑前动脉，位于前交通动脉起始部远端

B.en: Anterior cerebral artery proximal to the origin of the anterior communicating artery
B.zh: 大脑前动脉，位于前交通动脉起始部近端

C.en: Inferior division of the middle cerebral artery

D.en: Superior division of the middle cerebral artery

E.en: Trunk of the middle cerebral artery before the bifurcation
E.zh: 大脑中动脉干，在分叉前

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of cerebral artery anatomy and stroke syndromes, specifically the anterior cerebral artery (ACA) and its clinical presentation. It also assesses understanding of the Circle of Willis and its role in collateral blood flow. 

To solve this question, correlate the patient's symptoms (leg weakness and incontinence) with the brain regions supplied by each artery. Remember the homunculus and the location of motor and sensory representation for the lower extremities. Consider the impact of collateral circulation from the Circle of Willis.
summary.zh:
此题考察对脑动脉解剖和卒中综合征的知识，特别是大脑前动脉 (ACA) 及其临床表现。它还评估对 Willis 环及其在侧支血流中的作用的理解。

要解决此问题，请将患者的症状（腿部无力和失禁）与每条动脉供血的脑区相关联。记住体感图和下肢的运动和感觉代表的位置。考虑Willis环的侧支循环的影响。

tags: Stroke; Anterior cerebral artery; Circle of Willis; Urinary incontinence; Hemiparesis; Neurology; Vascular occlusion; Brain anatomy
